cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba and 105 mi S of Long Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest through the Bahamas, then turning northward skirting the Florida east coast toward Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the east–central Florida coast (around Cape Canaveral)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the Flagler/Volusia county line to Fernandina Beach, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: North Palm Beach to the Flagler/Volusia county line, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, especially from West Palm Beach northward through Jacksonville and into coastal Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (60% chance of ≥34 kt; 24% chance of ≥50 kt) with hurricane-force gusts possible as the core passes offshore Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening inundation of 3–5 ft above ground if peak surge coincides with high tide along the northeast Florida coast including Jacksonville.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches possible with isolated amounts up to 10 inches along the coast, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor coastal erosion.
